net.opentsdb.auth

Interface Authentication

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AllowAllAuthenticatingAuthorizer

    public interface Authentication
    A plugin interface for performing authentication for OpenTSDB API access. The plugin is embedded within the Netty pipeline and intercepts requests on new channels. Once a channel is authenticated successfully, the plugin is removed from the pipeline so further calls on that channel are not evaluated.

    An AuthState object is attached to the channel for evaluation later in the pipeline. This state cannot be changed but cane be replaced.

    The plugin also includes an acessor to an Authorization plugin to allow or disallow operations per user.

    Since:
    2.4

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(TSDB tsdb)
        Called by TSDB to initialize the plugin Implementations are responsible for setting up any IO they need as well as starting any required background threads. Note: Implementations should throw exceptions if they can't start up properly. The TSD will then shutdown so the operator can fix the problem. Please use IllegalArgumentException for configuration issues.
        Parameters:
        tsdb - The parent TSDB object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if required configuration parameters are missing
        RuntimeException - if something else goes wrong

      • shutdown

        com.stumbleupon.async.Deferred<Object> shutdown()
        Called to gracefully shutdown the plugin. Implementations should close any IO they have open
        Returns:
        A deferred object that indicates the completion of the request. The Object has not special meaning and can be null (think of it as Deferred<Void>).

      • version

        String version()
        Should return the version of this plugin in the format: MAJOR.MINOR.MAINT, e.g. 2.0.1. The MAJOR version should match the major version of OpenTSDB the plugin is meant to work with.
        Returns:
        A version string used to log the loaded version

      • collectStats

        void collectStats(StatsCollector collector)
        Called by the TSD when a request for statistics collection has come in. The implementation may provide one or more statistics. If no statistics are available for the implementation, simply stub the method.
        Parameters:
        collector - The collector used for emitting statistics

      • authenticateTelnet

        AuthState authenticateTelnet(org.jboss.netty.channel.Channel channel,
                             String[] command)
        Authenticate Telnet connections, provides the first line of the incoming connection.

        NOTE: This method should not throw exceptions, rather return a state object with the AuthStatus.ERROR status.

        Parameters:
        channel - A non-null Netty channel to associate with the request.
        command - A non-null list of "words" from a Telnet style command (strings or numbers separated by spaces)
        Returns:
        A non-null AuthState object with a valid AuthStatus to evaluate for a successful or unsuccessful authentication.

      • authenticateHTTP

        AuthState authenticateHTTP(org.jboss.netty.channel.Channel channel,
                           org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest req)
        Authenticate HTTP connections, provides the HTTPRequest object for the incoming connection.

        NOTE: This method should not throw exceptions, rather return a state object with the AuthStatus.ERROR status.

        Parameters:
        channel - A non-null Netty channel to associate with the request.
        req - A non-null HTTP request.
        Returns:
        A non-null AuthState object with a valid AuthStatus to evaluate for a successful or unsuccessful authentication.

      • authorization

        Authorization authorization()
        An optional authorization object. If authorization is not enabled, this call may return null.
        Returns:
        An authorization object or null;

      • isReady

        boolean isReady(TSDB tsdb,
                org.jboss.netty.channel.Channel chan)
        Function to determine if the authorization and authentication system is valid for this channel.
        Parameters:
        tsdb - the current tsdb
        chan - the current channel
        Returns:
        returns true if the authc/authz state is valid for the provided channel
